About me

Career - Software developer üì±

Throughout my life, I always choose to contribute every little tiny effort to make our world a better place. This inspirits me to build software applications that care for the users and utilize the technologies to enhance people's lives.

Center for Innovation and Research in Computing, SAU

Android Developer (2017)

Project: Adventist Giving.

I was hired by Center for Innovation and Research in Computing at Southern Adventist University as a Student Intern in January 2017. This was my first-time ever for a computing job, and I did not know my passion for software development until after I start building a mobile application from scratch. My manager at the time inspired to work towards improving myself as programmer, not towards getting things done. Within only 8 months, without skipping a week of work, I successfully programmed a fully-functioning Android. The application is called Adventist Giving and it is published on Google App Store. To see more information about this project, please see my projects page.

IT Department, SAU

iOS Developer (2018 - Present)

Project: Southern Adventist University, Attendance Tracking System, ATS API, Room Schedule.

I have been working for IT department at Southern Adventist University since April 2018. Fast forward from the time I worked on Android development, now my next challenge was iOS. I fell in love with the very informative and modern looking of Xcode and the Swift language. This helped me a lot in learning the tools and becoming an iOS Developer. The job assigned me to build functions and improve the Southern Adventist University iOS application. I was also building MVC web apps for the official website of the school. See my projects page.

Personal

Project: Laboratory, Klozet.

Everyone of us, once in a while, has an awesome idea and then let it go just minutes later. I feel sad knowing that happens. This is why I decided to spend my freetime to transform some of my stupid ideas into useful products. The two biggest ones are Laboratory and Klozet. To see more information, check out my projects here.
